intro: Salsola kali var. nodiflora, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, characterized by its spiny stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant is well adapted to harsh conditions, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry, nutrient-poor soils. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, helping to conserve water. It is often considered an invasive species in many regions due to its rapid growth and ability to spread prolifically.
